p: This study was conducted in the subtropical Zhangjiang Estuary Mangrove National Nature Reserve (23°53′–23°57′ N, 117°23′–117°30′ E), Zhangzhou, Fujian Province in southeastern China. The reserve is located at the mouth of the Zhangjiang River and has a subtropical marine monsoon climate. The mean annual temperature of this reserve is 21.2 °C and the annual mean rainfall was 1714.5 mm, most of which occurs from April to September. The soil of this reserve contains a high salt content (generally above 1%). There are 13 clusters including the Aegiceras corniculatum forest, and the dominant mangrove plants are Kandelia obovata, Avicennia marina, and Bruguiera gymnorrhiza. The canopy height is 3–5 m. The protected area is rich in wetland resources with typical and representative ecological environments.
